101.questionText: What are your thoughts about the importance of money in our lives?

102.questionText: Is energy important in acquiring more money?

103.questionText: Is your future vision important in having large sums of money one day?

104.questionText: Is it important to keep company with people who have a good attitude toward money?

105.questionText: I feel confident with the way I receive, budget and keep track of money either in the form of an allowance or earnings from a job.

106.questionText: I always keep my financial commitments. I pay all my bills on time.

107.questionText: I am happy with my relationship with money. I have positive feelings about it.

108.questionText: I spend wisely. I don’t overspend.

111.questionText: Describe the highlights of your experiences with money and share how you felt about them.

121.questionText: Describe the highlights of your most memorable feelings and experiences with money and share how you felt about them.

131.questionText: Rewrite your financial story—-the story you tell yourself about money—and fill it with examples of abundance you wish for!

201.questionText: What are your thoughts about the importance of saving money for the future?

202.questionText: Is saving important in acquiring more money?

203.questionText: Is saving important in having large sums of money one day?

204.questionText: Is it important to keep company with people who have a good attitude toward saving?

205.questionText: I feel confident with the way I save money either in the form of part of an allowance or earnings from a job.

206.questionText: I always save part of what I make.

207.questionText: I have a savings mindset. Money doesn't “burn a hole” in my pocket

208.questionText: I like to make money. I'm always looking for new ways to do it.

211.questionText: Describe what features you want in a savings account.

221.questionText: Describe your feelings and experience when there was not enough money.

222.questionText: Now describe the new money habits you want to develop to prevent that from happening, ever.

231.questionText: What is the secret to avoiding credit card debt?

232.questionText: What is the next best action, if that is not possible?

241.questionText: Describe the benefits of being an entrepreneur as well as the less attractive aspects of it

242.questionText: Discuss what career opportunities, in addition to entrepreneurial possibilities, appeal to you.

243.questionText: Describe the benefits of being an employee as well as the less attractive aspects of it.

50.questionText: At 21% interest rate, how long would it take to double your money/debt?

52.questionText: List the techniques for managing emotions.

53.questionText: How should you deal with emotional upset?

54.questionText: Name two characteristics of high emotional IQ.

55.questionText: What parts of the brain are activated by emotional upset?

56.questionText: What parts of the brain are activated by emotional upset?

57.questionText: What parts of the brain are activated by emotional upset?

58.questionText: What negative myths, judgements or messages have I inherited about certain emotions??

59.questionText: What is it like to know I have carried around these false ideas all this time?

60.questionText: What changes can I make to my life and my place in that world to address these emotional myths?

61.questionText: I feel confident with the way I receive, budget, spend, and keep track of money, either in the form of an allowance or earnings from a job.

62.questionText: I am always on time for school, work, and other commitments.

63.questionText: I organize my time and plan ahead to make sure that I allow enough time to get everything done.

64.questionText: I am happy with the way I organize my priorities, ensuring that I have enough time to dedicate to all the different aspects of my life.

65.questionText: The choices I make about what I eat and drink are healthy.

66.questionText: I have positive feelings about my relationship with food (what I eat, why I eat and how often I eat).

67.questionText: I am satisfied with the amount of exercise I get on a regular basis.

68.questionText: I determine what is right for me, in terms of weight and appearance, rather than letting my peers or culture determine that for me.
